iiv.util

Class DisplayNumberFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.text.Format
      • java.text.NumberFormat
        • java.text.DecimalFormat
          • iiv.util.DisplayNumberFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    iiVScriptable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DisplayNumberFormat
extends java.text.DecimalFormat
implements iiVScriptable
    DisplayNumberFrom extends DecimalFormat to incorporate exponents and handles number format defaults for most iiV display components.
    Since:
    iiV1.142
    See Also:
    NumberFormattable, Serialized Form

      • setDefaultExponentMultiples

        public static void setDefaultExponentMultiples(int exponentMultiples)
        Sets the default exponent multiples of 10 for the exponent portion of a number. Exponents multiples of 1 is standard scientific notation and exponent multiples of 3 is standard engineering notation. A exponent multiple 0 or less allows for no exponent.
        Parameters:
        exponentMultiples - exponent multiples

      • getDefaultExponentMultiples

        public static int getDefaultExponentMultiples()
        Gets the default exponent multiple of 10 for the exponent portion of a number.
        Returns:
        exponent multiple 0 for no exponent

      • setDefaultExponentSymbol

        Sets the default exponent symbol.
        Parameters:
        exponentSymbol - exponent symbol

      • getDefaultExponentSymbol

        Gets the default exponent symbol.
        Returns:
        exponent symbol

      • setExponentMultiples

        public void setExponentMultiples(int exponentMultiples)
        Sets the exponent multiples of 10 for the exponent portion of a number. Exponents multiples of 1 is standard scientific notation and exponent multiples of 3 is standard engineering notation. A exponent multiple 0 or less allows for no exponent.
        Parameters:
        exponentMultiples - exponent multiple. if < 0 sets to current default

      • getExponentMultiples

        public int getExponentMultiples()
        Gets the exponent multiple of 10 for the exponent portion of a number.
        Returns:
        exponent multiple 0 for no exponent

      • setExponentSymbol

        public void setExponentSymbol(java.lang.String exponentSymbol)
        Sets the exponent symbol.
        Parameters:
        exponentSymbol - exponent symbol. ifnull sets to current default

      • postObjectToScript

        public java.lang.String postObjectToScript(CNUScriptObjects scriptedObjects)
        Creates a script to recreate the parent NumberFormat settings on an existing copy. This script only deals with NumberFormat settings that are normally changed. Other settings are left to locality defaults.
        Parameters:
        scriptedObjects - scripted objects list this object already exists in.
        Returns:
        script to recreate this component

      • numberFormatPostObjectToScript

        public static java.lang.String numberFormatPostObjectToScript(CNUScriptObjects scriptedObjects,
                                                              java.text.NumberFormat nf)
        Creates a script to recreate NumberFormat settings. This script only deals with NumberFormat settings that are normally changed. Other settings are left to locality defaults.
        Parameters:
        scriptedObjects - scripted objects list this object already exists in.
        nf - number format object to base settings on.
        Returns:
        CNU script to change the objects settings

      • numberFormatToScript

        public static java.lang.String numberFormatToScript(CNUScriptObjects scriptedObjects,
                                                    java.text.NumberFormat nf)
        Creates a script to recreate NumberFormat settings. This script only deals with NumberFormat settings that are normally changed. Other settings are left to locality defaults.
        Parameters:
        scriptedObjects - scripted objects list this object already exists in.
        nf - number format object to base settings on.
        Returns:
        CNU script to change the objects settings
